Package net.royalur.notation

Class Notation

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.royalur.notation.Notation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonNotation, RGN
    public abstract class Notation
extends java.lang.Object
    A notation can be used as a shared format for distributing games of the Royal Game of Ur. Notations can be used to encode games into text, and to decode games from text. They are not guaranteed to be lossless in their conversion. Therefore, you should check the specific notation you are considering to determine the information that it is able to save.

      • encodeGame

        @Nonnull
public abstract <P extends Piece,​S extends PlayerState,​R extends Roll> java.lang.String encodeGame​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                               Game<P,​S,​R> game)
        Encodes the given game, game, into text.
        Type Parameters:
        P - The type of pieces that are stored on the board.
        S - The type of state that is stored for each player.
        R - The type of rolls that may be made.
        Parameters:
        game - The game to be encoded.
        Returns:
        Text that represents game in this notation.

      • decodeGame

        @Nonnull
public abstract <P extends Piece,​S extends PlayerState,​R extends Roll> Game<P,​S,​R> decodeGame​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                                      RuleSet<P,​S,​R> rules,
                                                                                                                      @Nonnull
                                                                                                                      java.lang.String encoded)
        Decodes the game from the text encoded, based upon the rules rules.
        Type Parameters:
        P - The type of pieces that are stored on the board.
        S - The type of state that is stored for each player.
        R - The type of rolls that may be made.
        Parameters:
        rules - The rules used to simulate the game as it is decoded.
        encoded - The text to decode into a game.
        Returns:
        The decoded game.
